Thanks!

- Indent by 2 spaces (not 4), checkstyle is giving many warnings about that (click the green check mark to see the travis-ci output)
- Each new file needs to have AL 2.0 license header
- Commit messages subject line is limited to 72 chars, please make it short and also use the body of it
- We strongly recommend to set up Eclipse or Intellij with the style files from our code convention page (https://opennlp.apache.org/code-conventions.html)
- Update the commit above e.g. via git commit --amend or squash and then force push (git push -f) to update the PR

Thank you. Please feel free to submit other contributions.

You keep saying is not an issue, but it is. You shouldn't be forced to be in a specific directory to run an app. Even more... the directory you have to be in is not even the directory that contains the file. You should be able to run the script form anywhere, or at least document it.
@marghidanu the fix you proposed also forces you to be in a specific directory, just a different one.
You're right, but at least it runs from the directory where the file actually is. It should make use of the  **dirname $0** command.
For us it is about consistency and documentation. So we decided let users always run our scripts with bin/xyz. If you would like to improve that and send us a PR where we can run from any directory.

How does this change work out for existing language models?

they still can be used as they are based on the underlying ngram model, which doesn't change.
Probabilities and next tokens predictions would change for models with ngram.size < 1M because of the new default discounting.
Constructors having the smoothing parameter have been removed, hence I set the fixVersion in Jira to 1.8.0.
sounds good, then we don't have to do anything, otherwise we could have added some code to reject loading them

Merged this now and updated your commit message:
NoJira: Add checkstyle for new lines and fix existing files
could u also include fixes for any violations as part of this PR ? That should fix everything for this JIRA, the build fails once this rule is enabled and the violation happens in several places.
..and please squash your commits when updating the PR
This PR should have been closed, I see that the code has been merged already.
The coverage is at 50% when run locally, will merge this to master.

@smarthi I thought squashing was done when You merge the PR into master. To me it looks like a setting on the repository. https://help.github.com/articles/configuring-commit-squashing-for-pull-requests/
@smarthi I can also re-create this PR with a single commit. But to me it looks like the squashing should be done by you. Or please advise me how to squash.

The way this works:
- The PR is always like your branch
- Use git rebase -i HEAD~n to squash your commits
- Update your branch via git push --force (this can overwrite existing commits)

A common mistake is to rebase/squash commits and then do a git push followed by git pull (this then wants to merge the changes you want to overwrite).

We prefer to get clean PRs with just one commits.

He worked on the unit test (as we said in OPENNLP-229) and then figured out that our code is not working and opened the issue which lead to this PR.

I suggest we just merge the two PRs together, first the one with the fix and then the test case.

Well done, let me merge this now. The commit message should be written in imperative for example:OPENNLP-990: Fix all array style violations and add a check style rule

Commit message in imperative and it should contain the jira:
OPENNLP-229: Add test for NameFinderSequenceValidator

And a easy way to update an existing PR is:
- git commit --amend (to add some changes to the last commit)
- git push -f (to overwrite your remote branch with the new commit)

Not sure how the three letter code check shall be done, there are many many places where it is used. One suggestion I have would be to use a Language type instead of String. I propose we leave validation for later and open a new jira for that. Also the models we distribute could be updated to return the new codes for 1.8.0.

OPENNLP-989: Fix validation of CONT after START with different type
